intro: Polygala mossii, commonly known as the mossy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes approximately 750 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Polygala mossii is well adapted to drought conditions, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils.
